item.title: Movie Milton Glasser
item.dc:creator: Miki
item.content:encoded:
Milton Glasser

Art, Illustration

Milton Glaser, a legendary American graphic designer, is celebrated for his iconic and versatile body of work that spans several decades. He co-founded the revolutionary Push Pin Studios and is perhaps best known for creating the iconic "I ❤ NY" logo, a symbol recognized worldwide. Glaser's eclectic style, characterized by bold colors, playful illustrations, and a deep understanding of visual communication, has left an indelible imprint on the design world.

Versions

item.title: Movie Paul Rand
item.dc:creator: Miki
item.content:encoded:
Paul Rand

Art, Illustration

Paul Rand, a trailblazing American graphic designer, is revered for his pioneering contributions to modern graphic design and corporate branding. Renowned for his minimalist approach and emphasis on simplicity, Rand's work often featured clean lines, geometric shapes, and innovative typography. Notable for creating iconic logos, including those for IBM, ABC, and UPS, Rand's designs seamlessly blended form and function. His profound influence on the field, coupled with his commitment to the idea that design should communicate effectively and enduringly, cements his legacy as a visionary in the world of graphic design.

Versions

item.title: Movie Saul Bass
item.dc:creator: Miki
item.content:encoded:
Saul Bass

Art, Illustration

Saul Bass, an influential American graphic designer and filmmaker, is widely regarded as a pioneer in the field of film title sequences. Renowned for his innovative approach to visual storytelling, Bass transformed the opening credits of films into powerful and memorable works of art. His iconic designs for films like "Psycho," "Vertigo," and "Anatomy of a Murder" elevated the status of film graphics to an art form. United Airlines.

Versions
